speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: For I am bold to counsel you in this.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Although we fancy not the cardinal,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Yet must we join with him and with the lords,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Till we have brought Duke Humphrey in disgrace.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As for the Duke of York, this late complaint

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Will make but little for his benefit.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So, one by one, well weed them all at last,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And you yourself shall steer the happy helm.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Sound a sennet. Enter KING HENRY VI, GLOUCESTER,  CARDINAL, BUCKINGHAM, YORK, SOMERSET, SALISBURY, WARWICK, and the DUCHESS

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For my part, noble lords, I care not which;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Or Somerset or York, alls one to me.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: If York have ill demeand himself in France,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Then let him be denayd the regentship.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: If Somerset be unworthy of the place,

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Let York be regent; I will yield to him.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Whether your grace be worthy, yea or no,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Dispute not that: York is the worthier.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Ambitious Warwick, let thy betters speak.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: The cardinals not my better in the field.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: All in this presence are thy betters, Warwick.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Warwick may live to be the best of all.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Peace, son! and show some reason, Buckingham,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Why Somerset should be preferred in this.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Because the king, forsooth, will have it so.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Madam, the king is old enough himself

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To give his censure: these are no womens matters.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: If he be old enough, what needs your grace

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To be protector of his excellence?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Madam, I am protector of the realm;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And, at his pleasure, will resign my place.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Resign it then and leave thine insolence.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Since thou wert king--as who is king but thou?--

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The commonwealth hath daily run to wreck;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The Dauphin hath prevaild beyond the seas;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And all the peers and nobles of the realm

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Have been as bondmen to thy sovereignty.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: The commons hast thou rackd; the clergys bags

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Are lank and lean with thy extortions.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Thy sumptuous buildings and thy wifes attire

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Have cost a mass of public treasury.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Thy cruelty in execution

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Upon offenders, hath exceeded law,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And left thee to the mercy of the law.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: They sale of offices and towns in France,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: If they were known, as the suspect is great,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Would make thee quickly hop without thy head.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Exit GLOUCESTER. QUEEN MARGARET drops her fan

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Give me my fan: what, minion! can ye not?

text_entry: She gives the DUCHESS a box on the ear

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I cry you mercy, madam; was it you?

text_entry: Wast I! yea, I it was, proud Frenchwoman:

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Could I come near your beauty with my nails,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Id set my ten commandments in your face.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Sweet aunt, be quiet; twas against her will.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Against her will! good king, look tot in time;

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Shell hamper thee, and dandle thee like a baby:

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Though in this place most master wear no breeches,

speaker: DUCHESS

speaker: DUCHESS

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Shell gallop far enough to her destruction.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Exit

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Now, lords, my choler being over-blown

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: With walking once about the quadrangle,

text_entry: I come to talk of commonwealth affairs.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As for your spiteful false objections,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Prove them, and I lie open to the law:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But God in mercy so deal with my soul,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As I in duty love my king and country!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But, to the matter that we have in hand:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I say, my sovereign, York is meetest man

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To be your regent in the realm of France.

text_entry: Before we make election, give me leave

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To show some reason, of no little force,

text_entry: That York is most unmeet of any man.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Ill tell thee, Suffolk, why I am unmeet:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: First, for I cannot flatter thee in pride;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Next, if I be appointed for the place,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: My Lord of Somerset will keep me here,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Without discharge, money, or furniture,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Till France be won into the Dauphins hands:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Last time, I danced attendance on his will

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Till Paris was besieged, famishd, and lost.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: That can I witness; and a fouler fact

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Did never traitor in the land commit.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Peace, headstrong Warwick!

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Image of pride, why should I hold my peace?

text_entry: Base dunghill villain and mechanical,

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: accusation.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: This doom, my lord, if I may judge:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Let Somerset be regent over the French,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Because in York this breeds suspicion:

speaker: GLOUCESTER

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: For single combat in convenient place,

speaker: GLOUCESTER

speaker: SOMERSET

speaker: HORNER

speaker: PETER

speaker: PETER
text_entry: my case. The spite of man prevaileth against me. O

speaker: PETER

speaker: PETER

speaker: GLOUCESTER

speaker: KING HENRY VI

speaker: KING HENRY VI

speaker: KING HENRY VI

speaker: KING HENRY VI

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Although by his sight his sin be multiplied.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Stand by, my masters: bring him near the king;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: His highness pleasure is to talk with him.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Good fellow, tell us here the circumstance,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That we for thee may glorify the Lord.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: What, hast thou been long blind and now restored?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Born blind, ant please your grace.

speaker: Wife
text_entry: Ay, indeed, was he.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: What woman is this?

speaker: Wife
text_entry: His wife, ant like your worship.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Hadst thou been his mother, thou couldst have

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: better told.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Where wert thou born?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: At Berwick in the north, ant like your grace.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Poor soul, Gods goodness hath been great to thee:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Let never day nor night unhallowd pass,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: But still remember what the Lord hath done.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Tell me, good fellow, camest thou here by chance,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Or of devotion, to this holy shrine?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: God knows, of pure devotion; being calld

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: A hundred times and oftener, in my sleep,

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: By good Saint Alban; who said, Simpcox, come,

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Come, offer at my shrine, and I will help thee.

speaker: Wife
text_entry: Most true, forsooth; and many time and oft

speaker: Wife
text_entry: Myself have heard a voice to call him so.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: What, art thou lame?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Ay, God Almighty help me!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: How camest thou so?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: A fall off of a tree.

speaker: Wife
text_entry: A plum-tree, master.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: How long hast thou been blind?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Born so, master.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What, and wouldst climb a tree?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: But that in all my life, when I was a youth.

speaker: Wife
text_entry: Too true; and bought his climbing very dear.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Mass, thou lovedst plums well, that wouldst

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: venture so.

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Alas,  good master, my wife desired some damsons,

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: And made me climb, with danger of my life.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: A subtle knave! but yet it shall not serve.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Let me see thine eyes: wink now: now open them:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: In my opinion yet thou seest not well.

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Yes, master, clear as day, I thank God and

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Saint Alban.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Sayst thou me so? What colour is this cloak of?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Red, master; red as blood.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Why, thats well said. What colour is my gown of?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Black, forsooth: coal-black as jet.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Why, then, thou knowst what colour jet is of?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And yet, I think, jet did he never see.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But cloaks and gowns, before this day, a many.

speaker: Wife
text_entry: Never, before this day, in all his life.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Tell me, sirrah, whats my name?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Alas, master, I know not.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Whats his name?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: I know not.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Nor his?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: No, indeed, master.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Whats thine own name?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Saunder Simpcox, an if it please you, master.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Then, Saunder, sit there, the lyingest knave in

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Christendom. If thou hadst been born blind, thou

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: mightest as well have known all our names as thus to

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: name the several colours we do wear. Sight may

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: distinguish of colours, but suddenly to nominate them

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: all, it is impossible. My lords, Saint Alban here

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: hath done a miracle; and would ye not think his

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: cunning to be great, that could restore this cripple

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: to his legs again?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: O master, that you could!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: My masters of Saint Albans, have you not beadles in

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: your town, and things called whips?

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Yes, my lord, if it please your grace.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Then send for one presently.

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Sirrah, go fetch the beadle hither straight.

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Exit an Attendant

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Now fetch me a stool hither by and by. Now, sirrah,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: if you mean to save yourself from whipping, leap me

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: over this stool and run away.

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Alas, master, I am not able to stand alone:

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: You go about to torture me in vain.

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Enter a Beadle with whips

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Well, sir, we must have you find your legs. Sirrah

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: beadle, whip him till he leap over that same stool.

speaker: Beadle
text_entry: I will, my lord. Come on, sirrah; off with your

speaker: Beadle
text_entry: doublet quickly.

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Alas, master, what shall I do? I am not able to stand.

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: After the Beadle hath hit him once, he leaps over the stool and runs away; and they follow and cry, A miracle!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: O God, seest Thou this, and bearest so long?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: It made me laugh to see the villain run.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Follow the knave; and take this drab away.

speaker: Wife
text_entry: Alas, sir, we did it for pure need.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Let them be whipped through every market-town, till

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: they come to Berwick, from whence they came.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exeunt Wife, Beadle, Mayor,  and c

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Duke Humphrey has done a miracle to-day.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: True; made the lame to leap and fly away.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But you have done more miracles than I;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: You made in a day, my lord, whole towns to fly.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Enter BUCKINGHAM

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: What tidings with our cousin Buckingham?

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Such as my heart doth tremble to unfold.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: A sort of naughty persons, lewdly bent,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Under the countenance and confederacy

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Of Lady Eleanor, the protectors wife,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: The ringleader and head of all this rout,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Have practised dangerously against your state,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Dealing with witches and with conjurers:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Whom we have apprehended in the fact;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Raising up wicked spirits from under ground,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Demanding of King Henrys life and death,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And other of your highness privy-council;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: As more at large your grace shall understand.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: [Aside to GLOUCESTER]  And so, my lord protector,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: by this means

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Your lady is forthcoming yet at London.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: This news, I think, hath turnd your weapons edge;

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Tis like, my lord, you will not keep your hour.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ambitious churchman, leave to afflict my heart:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Sorrow and grief have vanquishd all my powers;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And, vanquishd as I am, I yield to thee,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Or to the meanest groom.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: O God, what mischiefs work the wicked ones,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Heaping confusion on their own heads thereby!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Gloucester, see here the tainture of thy nest.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And look thyself be faultless, thou wert best.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Madam, for myself, to heaven I do appeal,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: How I have loved my king and commonweal:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And, for my wife, I know not how it stands;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Sorry I am to hear what I have heard:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Noble she is, but if she have forgot

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Honour and virtue and conversed with such

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As, like to pitch, defile nobility,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I banish her my bed and company

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And give her as a prey to law and shame,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: That hath dishonourd Gloucesters honest name.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Well, for this night we will repose us here:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To-morrow toward London back again,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To look into this business thoroughly

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And call these foul offenders to their answers

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And poise the cause in justice equal scales,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Whose beam stands sure, whose rightful cause prevails.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Flourish. Exeunt

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: SCENE II. London. YORKS garden.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Enter YORK, SALISBURY, and WARWICK

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Now, my good Lords of Salisbury and Warwick,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Our simple supper ended, give me leave

speaker: YORK
text_entry: In this close walk to satisfy myself,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: In craving your opinion of my title,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Which is infallible, to Englands crown.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: My lord, I long to hear it at full.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Sweet York, begin: and if thy claim be good,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: The Nevils are thy subjects to command.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Then thus:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Edward the Third, my lords, had seven sons:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The first, Edward the Black Prince, Prince of Wales;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The second, William of Hatfield, and the third,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Lionel Duke of Clarence: next to whom

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Was John of Gaunt, the Duke of Lancaster;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The fifth was Edmund Langley, Duke of York;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The sixth was Thomas of Woodstock, Duke of Gloucester;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: William of Windsor was the seventh and last.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Edward the Black Prince died before his father

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And left behind him Richard, his only son,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Who after Edward the Thirds death reignd as king;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Till Henry Bolingbroke, Duke of Lancaster,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The eldest son and heir of John of Gaunt,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Crownd by the name of Henry the Fourth,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Seized on the realm, deposed the rightful king,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Sent his poor queen to France, from whence she came,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And him to Pomfret; where, as all you know,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Harmless Richard was murderd traitorously.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Father, the duke hath told the truth:

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Thus got the house of Lancaster the crown.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Which now they hold by force and not by right;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: For Richard, the first sons heir, being dead,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The issue of the next son should have reignd.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: But William of Hatfield died without an heir.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The third son, Duke of Clarence, from whose line

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I claimed the crown, had issue, Philippe, a daughter,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Who married Edmund Mortimer, Earl of March:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Edmund had issue, Roger Earl of March;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Roger had issue, Edmund, Anne and Eleanor.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: This Edmund, in the reign of Bolingbroke,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: As I have read, laid claim unto the crown;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And, but for Owen Glendower, had been king,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Who kept him in captivity till he died.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: But to the rest.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: His eldest sister, Anne,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: My mother, being heir unto the crown

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Married Richard Earl of Cambridge; who was son

speaker: YORK
text_entry: To Edmund Langley, Edward the Thirds fifth son.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: By her I claim the kingdom: she was heir

speaker: YORK
text_entry: To Roger Earl of March, who was the son

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Of Edmund Mortimer, who married Philippe,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Sole daughter unto Lionel Duke of Clarence:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: So, if the issue of the elder son

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Succeed before the younger, I am king.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: What plain proceeding is more plain than this?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Henry doth claim the crown from John of Gaunt,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: The fourth son; York claims it from the third.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Till Lionels issue fails, his should not reign:

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: It fails not yet, but flourishes in thee

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And in thy sons, fair slips of such a stock.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Then, father Salisbury, kneel we together;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And in this private plot be we the first

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: That shall salute our rightful sovereign

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: With honour of his birthright to the crown.

speaker: BOTH
text_entry: Long live our sovereign Richard, Englands king!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: We thank you, lords. But I am not your king

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Till I be crownd and that my sword be staind

speaker: YORK
text_entry: With heart-blood of the house of Lancaster;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And thats not suddenly to be performd,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: But with advice and silent secrecy.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Do you as I do in these dangerous days:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Wink at the Duke of Suffolks insolence,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: At Beauforts pride, at Somersets ambition,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: At Buckingham and all the crew of them,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Till they have snared the shepherd of the flock,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: That virtuous prince, the good Duke Humphrey:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Tis that they seek, and they in seeking that

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Shall find their deaths, if York can prophesy.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: My lord, break we off; we know your mind at full.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: My heart assures me that the Earl of Warwick

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Shall one day make the Duke of York a king.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And, Nevil, this I do assure myself:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Richard shall live to make the Earl of Warwick

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The greatest man in England but the king.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: YORK
text_entry: SCENE III. A hall of justice.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Sound trumpets. Enter KING HENRY VI, QUEEN  MARGARET, GLOUCESTER, YORK, SUFFOLK, and SALISBURY;  the DUCHESS, MARGARET JOURDAIN, SOUTHWELL, HUME, and BOLINGBROKE, under guard

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Stand forth, Dame Eleanor Cobham, Gloucesters wife:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: In sight of God and us, your guilt is great:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Receive the sentence of the law for sins

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Such as by Gods book are adjudged to death.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: You four, from hence to prison back again;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: From thence unto the place of execution:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: The witch in Smithfield shall be burnd to ashes,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And you three shall be strangled on the gallows.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: You, madam, for you are more nobly born,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Despoiled of your honour in your life,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Shall, after three days open penance done,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Live in your country here in banishment,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: With Sir John Stanley, in the Isle of Man.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Welcome is banishment; welcome were my death.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Eleanor, the law, thou seest, hath judged thee:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I cannot justify whom the law condemns.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exeunt DUCHESS and other prisoners, guarded

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Mine eyes are full of tears, my heart of grief.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ah, Humphrey, this dishonour in thine age

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Will bring thy head with sorrow to the ground!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I beseech your majesty, give me leave to go;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Sorrow would solace and mine age would ease.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Stay, Humphrey Duke of Gloucester: ere thou go,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Give up thy staff: Henry will to himself

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Protector be; and God shall be my hope,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My stay, my guide and lantern to my feet:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And go in peace, Humphrey, no less beloved

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Than when thou wert protector to thy King.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I see no reason why a king of years

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Should be to be protected like a child.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: God and King Henry govern Englands realm.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Give up your staff, sir, and the king his realm.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: My staff? here, noble Henry, is my staff:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As willingly do I the same resign

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As eer thy father Henry made it mine;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And even as willingly at thy feet I leave it

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As others would ambitiously receive it.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Farewell, good king: when I am dead and gone,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: May honourable peace attend thy throne!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exit

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Why, now is Henry king, and Margaret queen;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And Humphrey Duke of Gloucester scarce himself,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That bears so shrewd a maim; two pulls at once;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: His lady banishd, and a limb loppd off.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: This staff of honour raught, there let it stand

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Where it best fits to be, in Henrys hand.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Thus droops this lofty pine and hangs his sprays;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Thus Eleanors pride dies in her youngest days.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Lords, let him go. Please it your majesty,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: This is the day appointed for the combat;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And ready are the appellant and defendant,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The armourer and his man, to enter the lists,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: So please your highness to behold the fight.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Ay, good my lord; for purposely therefore

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Left I the court, to see this quarrel tried.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: O Gods name, see the lists and all things fit:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Here let them end it; and God defend the right!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I never saw a fellow worse bested,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Or more afraid to fight, than is the appellant,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The servant of this armourer, my lords.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Enter at one door, HORNER, the Armourer, and his  Neighbours, drinking to him so much that he is drunk;  and he enters with a drum before him and his staff  with a sand-bag fastened to it; and at the other  door PETER, his man, with a drum and sand-bag, and Prentices drinking to him

speaker: First Neighbour
text_entry: Here, neighbour Horner, I drink to you in a cup of

speaker: First Neighbour
text_entry: sack: and fear not, neighbour, you shall do well enough.

speaker: Second Neighbour
text_entry: And here, neighbour, heres a cup of charneco.

speaker: Third Neighbour
text_entry: And heres a pot of good double beer, neighbour:

speaker: Third Neighbour
text_entry: drink, and fear not your man.

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: Let it come, i faith, and Ill pledge you all; and

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: a fig for Peter!

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: First PrenticeHere, Peter, I drink to thee: and be not afraid.

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: Second PrenticeBe merry, Peter, and fear not thy master: fight

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: for credit of the prentices.

speaker: PETER
text_entry: I thank you all: drink, and pray for me, I pray

speaker: PETER
text_entry: you; for I think I have taken my last draught in

speaker: PETER
text_entry: this world. Here, Robin, an if I die, I give thee

speaker: PETER
text_entry: my apron: and, Will, thou shalt have my hammer:

speaker: PETER
text_entry: and here, Tom, take all the money that I have. O

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Lord bless me! I pray God! for I am never able to

speaker: PETER
text_entry: deal with my master, he hath learnt me so much fence already.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Come, leave your drinking, and fall to blows.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Sirrah, whats thy name?

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Peter, forsooth.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Peter! what more?

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Thump.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Thump! then see thou thump thy master well.

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: Masters, I am come hither, as it were, upon my mans

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: instigation, to prove him a knave and myself an

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: honest man: and touching the Duke of York, I will

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: take my death, I never meant him any ill, nor the

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: king, nor the queen: and therefore, Peter, have at

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: thee with a downright blow!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Dispatch: this knaves tongue begins to double.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Sound, trumpets, alarum to the combatants!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Alarum. They fight, and PETER strikes him down

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: Hold, Peter, hold! I confess, I confess treason.

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: Dies

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Take away his weapon. Fellow, thank God, and the

speaker: YORK
text_entry: good wine in thy masters way.

speaker: PETER
text_entry: O God, have I overcome mine enemy in this presence?

speaker: PETER
text_entry: O Peter, thou hast prevailed in right!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Go, take hence that traitor from our sight;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For his death we do perceive his guilt:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And God in justice hath revealed to us

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: The truth and innocence of this poor fellow,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Which he had thought to have murderd wrongfully.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Come, fellow, follow us for thy reward.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Sound a flourish. Exeunt

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: SCENE IV. A street.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER and his Servingmen, in mourning cloaks

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thus sometimes hath the brightest day a cloud;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And after summer evermore succeeds

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Barren winter, with his wrathful nipping cold:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: So cares and joys abound, as seasons fleet.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Sirs, whats oclock?

speaker: Servants
text_entry: Ten, my lord.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ten is the hour that was appointed me

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To watch the coming of my punishd duchess:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Uneath may she endure the flinty streets,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To tread them with her tender-feeling feet.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Sweet Nell, ill can thy noble mind abrook

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The abject people gazing on thy face,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: With envious looks, laughing at thy shame,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: That erst did follow thy proud chariot-wheels

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: When thou didst ride in triumph through the streets.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But, soft! I think she comes; and Ill prepare

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: My tear-staind eyes to see her miseries.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Enter the DUCHESS in a white sheet, and a taper  burning in her hand; with STANLEY, the Sheriff, and Officers

speaker: Servant
text_entry: So please your grace, well take her from the sheriff.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: No, stir not, for your lives; let her pass by.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Come you, my lord, to see my open shame?

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Now thou dost penance too. Look how they gaze!

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: See how the giddy multitude do point,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And nod their heads, and throw their eyes on thee!

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Ah, Gloucester, hide thee from their hateful looks,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And, in thy closet pent up, rue my shame,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And ban thine enemies, both mine and thine!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Be patient, gentle Nell; forget this grief.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Ah, Gloucester, teach me to forget myself!

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: For whilst I think I am thy married wife

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And thou a prince, protector of this land,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Methinks I should not thus be led along,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Maild up in shame, with papers on my back,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And followed with a rabble that rejoice

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: To see my tears and hear my deep-fet groans.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: The ruthless flint doth cut my tender feet,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And when I start, the envious people laugh

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And bid me be advised how I tread.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Ah, Humphrey, can I bear this shameful yoke?

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Trowst thou that eer Ill look upon the world,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Or count them happy that enjoy the sun?

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: No; dark shall be my light and night my day;

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: To think upon my pomp shall be my hell.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Sometime Ill say, I am Duke Humphreys wife,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And he a prince and ruler of the land:

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Yet so he ruled and such a prince he was

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: As he stood by whilst I, his forlorn duchess,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Was made a wonder and a pointing-stock

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: To every idle rascal follower.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: But be thou mild and blush not at my shame,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Nor stir at nothing till the axe of death

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Hang over thee, as, sure, it shortly will;

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: For Suffolk, he that can do all in all

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: With her that hateth thee and hates us all,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And York and impious Beaufort, that false priest,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Have all limed bushes to betray thy wings,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And, fly thou how thou canst, theyll tangle thee:

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: But fear not thou, until thy foot be snared,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Nor never seek prevention of thy foes.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ah, Nell, forbear! thou aimest all awry;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I must offend before I be attainted;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And had I twenty times so many foes,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And each of them had twenty times their power,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: All these could not procure me any scathe,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: So long as I am loyal, true and crimeless.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Wouldst have me rescue thee from this reproach?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Why, yet thy scandal were not wiped away

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But I in danger for the breach of law.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thy greatest help is quiet, gentle Nell:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I pray thee, sort thy heart to patience;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: These few days wonder will be quickly worn.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Enter a Herald

speaker: Herald
text_entry: I summon your grace to his majestys parliament,

speaker: Herald
text_entry: Holden at Bury the first of this next month.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And my consent neer askd herein before!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: This is close dealing. Well, I will be there.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exit Herald

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: My Nell, I take my leave: and, master sheriff,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Let not her penance exceed the kings commission.

speaker: Sheriff
text_entry: Ant please your grace, here my commission stays,

speaker: Sheriff
text_entry: And Sir John Stanley is appointed now

speaker: Sheriff
text_entry: To take her with him to the Isle of Man.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Must you, Sir John, protect my lady here?

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: So am I given in charge, mayt please your grace.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Entreat her not the worse in that I pray

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: You use her well: the world may laugh again;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And I may live to do you kindness if

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: You do it her: and so, Sir John, farewell!

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: What, gone, my lord, and bid me not farewell!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Witness my tears, I cannot stay to speak.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exeunt GLOUCESTER and Servingmen

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Art thou gone too? all comfort go with thee!

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: For none abides with me: my joy is death;

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Death, at whose name I oft have been afeard,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Because I wishd this worlds eternity.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Stanley, I prithee, go, and take me hence;

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: I care not whither, for I beg no favour,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Only convey me where thou art commanded.

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: Why, madam, that is to the Isle of Man;

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: There to be used according to your state.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Thats bad enough, for I am but reproach:

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And shall I then be used reproachfully?

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: Like to a duchess, and Duke Humphreys lady;

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: According to that state you shall be used.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Sheriff, farewell, and better than I fare,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Although thou hast been conduct of my shame.

speaker: Sheriff
text_entry: It is my office; and, madam, pardon me.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Ay, ay, farewell; thy office is discharged.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Come, Stanley, shall we go?

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: Madam, your penance done, throw off this sheet,

speaker: STANLEY
text_entry: And go we to attire you for our journey.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: My shame will not be shifted with my sheet:

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: No, it will hang upon my richest robes

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And show itself, attire me how I can.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Go, lead the way; I long to see my prison.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: SCENE I. The Abbey at Bury St. Edmunds.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Sound a sennet. Enter KING HENRY VI, QUEEN  MARGARET, CARDINAL, SUFFOLK, YORK, BUCKINGHAM, SALISBURY and WARWICK to the Parliament

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I muse my Lord of Gloucester is not come:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Tis not his wont to be the hindmost man,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Whateer occasion keeps him from us now.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Can you not see? or will ye not observe

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The strangeness of his alterd countenance?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: With what a majesty he bears himself,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: How insolent of late he is become,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: How proud, how peremptory, and unlike himself?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: We know the time since he was mild and affable,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And if we did but glance a far-off look,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Immediately he was upon his knee,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That all the court admired him for submission:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: But meet him now, and, be it in the morn,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: When every one will give the time of day,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: He knits his brow and shows an angry eye,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And passeth by with stiff unbowed knee,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Disdaining duty that to us belongs.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Small curs are not regarded when they grin;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: But great men tremble when the lion roars;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And Humphrey is no little man in England.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: First note that he is near you in descent,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And should you fall, he as the next will mount.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Me seemeth then it is no policy,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Respecting what a rancorous mind he bears

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And his advantage following your decease,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That he should come about your royal person

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Or be admitted to your highness council.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: By flattery hath he won the commons hearts,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And when he please to make commotion,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Tis to be feard they all will follow him.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Now tis the spring, and weeds are shallow-rooted;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Suffer them now, and theyll oergrow the garden

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And choke the herbs for want of husbandry.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The reverent care I bear unto my lord

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Made me collect these dangers in the duke.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: If it be fond, call it a womans fear;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Which fear if better reasons can supplant,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I will subscribe and say I wrongd the duke.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: My Lord of Suffolk, Buckingham, and York,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Reprove my allegation, if you can;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Or else conclude my words effectual.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Well hath your highness seen into this duke;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And, had I first been put to speak my mind,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I think I should have told your graces tale.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The duchess, by his subornation,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Upon my life, began her devilish practises:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Or, if he were not privy to those faults,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Yet, by reputing of his high descent,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As next the king he was successive heir,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And such high vaunts of his nobility,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Did instigate the bedlam brain-sick duchess

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: By wicked means to frame our sovereigns fall.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Smooth runs the water where the brook is deep;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And in his simple show he harbours treason.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The fox barks not when he would steal the lamb.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: No, no, my sovereign; Gloucester is a man

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Unsounded yet and full of deep deceit.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Did he not, contrary to form of law,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Devise strange deaths for small offences done?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And did he not, in his protectorship,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Levy great sums of money through the realm

speaker: YORK
text_entry: For soldiers pay in France, and never sent it?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: By means whereof the towns each day revolted.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Tut, these are petty faults to faults unknown.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Which time will bring to light in smooth

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Duke Humphrey.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My lords, at once: the care you have of us,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To mow down thorns that would annoy our foot,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Is worthy praise: but, shall I speak my conscience,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Our kinsman Gloucester is as innocent

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: From meaning treason to our royal person

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: As is the sucking lamb or harmless dove:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: The duke is virtuous, mild and too well given

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To dream on evil or to work my downfall.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Ah, whats more dangerous than this fond affiance!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Seems he a dove? his feathers are but borrowed,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For hes disposed as the hateful raven:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Is he a lamb? his skin is surely lent him,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For hes inclined as is the ravenous wolf.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Who cannot steal a shape that means deceit?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Take heed, my lord; the welfare of us all

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Hangs on the cutting short that fraudful man.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Enter SOMERSET

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: All health unto my gracious sovereign!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Welcome, Lord Somerset. What news from France?

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: That all your interest in those territories

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Is utterly bereft you; all is lost.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Cold news, Lord Somerset: but Gods will be done!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: [Aside]  Cold news for me; for I had hope of France

speaker: YORK
text_entry: As firmly as I hope for fertile England.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Thus are my blossoms blasted in the bud

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And caterpillars eat my leaves away;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: But I will remedy this gear ere long,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Or sell my title for a glorious grave.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: All happiness unto my lord the king!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Pardon, my liege, that I have stayd so long.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Nay, Gloucester, know that thou art come too soon,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Unless thou wert more loyal than thou art:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I do arrest thee of high treason here.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Well, Suffolk, thou shalt not see me blush

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Nor change my countenance for this arrest:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: A heart unspotted is not easily daunted.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The purest spring is not so free from mud

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As I am clear from treason to my sovereign:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Who can accuse me? wherein am I guilty?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Tis thought, my lord, that you took bribes of France,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And, being protector, stayed the soldiers pay;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: By means whereof his highness hath lost France.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Is it but thought so? what are they that think it?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I never robbd the soldiers of their pay,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Nor ever had one penny bribe from France.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: So help me God, as I have watchd the night,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ay, night by night, in studying good for England,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: That doit that eer I wrested from the king,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Or any groat I hoarded to my use,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Be brought against me at my trial-day!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: No; many a pound of mine own proper store,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Because I would not tax the needy commons,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Have I disbursed to the garrisons,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And never askd for restitution.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: It serves you well, my lord, to say so much.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I say no more than truth, so help me God!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: In your protectorship you did devise

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Strange tortures for offenders never heard of,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: That England was defamed by tyranny.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Why, tis well known that, whiles I was

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: protector,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Pity was all the fault that was in me;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: For I should melt at an offenders tears,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And lowly words were ransom for their fault.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Unless it were a bloody murderer,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Or foul felonious thief that fleeced poor passengers,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I never gave them condign punishment:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Murder indeed, that bloody sin, I tortured

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Above the felon or what trespass else.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: My lord, these faults are easy, quickly answered:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But mightier crimes are laid unto your charge,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Whereof you cannot easily purge yourself.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I do arrest you in his highness name;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And here commit you to my lord cardinal

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To keep, until your further time of trial.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My lord of Gloucester, tis my special hope

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That you will clear yourself from all suspect:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My conscience tells me you are innocent.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ah, gracious lord, these days are dangerous:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Virtue is choked with foul ambition

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And charity chased hence by rancours hand;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Foul subornation is predominant

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And equity exiled your highness land.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I know their complot is to have my life,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And if my death might make this island happy,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And prove the period of their tyranny,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I would expend it with all willingness:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But mine is made the prologue to their play;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: For thousands more, that yet suspect no peril,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Will not conclude their plotted tragedy.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Beauforts red sparkling eyes blab his hearts malice,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And Suffolks cloudy brow his stormy hate;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Sharp Buckingham unburthens with his tongue

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The envious load that lies upon his heart;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And dogged York, that reaches at the moon,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Whose overweening arm I have pluckd back,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: By false accuse doth level at my life:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And you, my sovereign lady, with the rest,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Causeless have laid disgraces on my head,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And with your best endeavour have stirrd up

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: My liefest liege to be mine enemy:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ay, all you have laid your heads together--

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Myself had notice of your conventicles--

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And all to make away my guiltless life.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I shall not want false witness to condemn me,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Nor store of treasons to augment my guilt;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The ancient proverb will be well effected:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: A staff is quickly found to beat a dog.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: My liege, his railing is intolerable:

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: If those that care to keep your royal person

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: From treasons secret knife and traitors rage

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Be thus upbraided, chid and rated at,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: And the offender granted scope of speech,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Twill make them cool in zeal unto your grace.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Hath he not twit our sovereign lady here

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: With ignominious words, though clerkly couchd,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As if she had suborned some to swear

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: False allegations to oerthrow his state?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: But I can give the loser leave to chide.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Far truer spoke than meant: I lose, indeed;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Beshrew the winners, for they playd me false!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And well such losers may have leave to speak.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Hell wrest the sense and hold us here all day:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Lord cardinal, he is your prisoner.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Sirs, take away the duke, and guard him sure.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ah! thus King Henry throws away his crutch

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Before his legs be firm to bear his body.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thus is the shepherd beaten from thy side,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And wolves are gnarling who shall gnaw thee first.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ah, that my fear were false! ah, that it were!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: For, good King Henry, thy decay I fear.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exit, guarded

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My lords, what to your wisdoms seemeth best,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Do or undo, as if ourself were here.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What, will your highness leave the parliament?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Ay, Margaret; my heart is drownd with grief,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Whose flood begins to flow within mine eyes,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My body round engirt with misery,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For whats more miserable than discontent?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Ah, uncle Humphrey! in thy face I see

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: The map of honour, truth and loyalty:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And yet, good Humphrey, is the hour to come

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That eer I proved thee false or feard thy faith.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: What louring star now envies thy estate,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That these great lords and Margaret our queen

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Do seek subversion of thy harmless life?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Thou never didst them wrong, nor no man wrong;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And as the butcher takes away the calf

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And binds the wretch, and beats it when it strays,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Bearing it to the bloody slaughter-house,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Even so remorseless have they borne him hence;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And as the dam runs lowing up and down,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Looking the way her harmless young one went,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And can do nought but wail her darlings loss,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Even so myself bewails good Gloucesters case

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: With sad unhelpful tears, and with dimmd eyes

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Look after him and cannot do him good,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: So mighty are his vowed enemies.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: His fortunes I will weep; and, twixt each groan

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Say Whos a traitor? Gloucester he is none.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Exeunt all but QUEEN MARGARET, CARDINAL, SUFFOLK, and YORK; SOMERSET remains apart

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Free lords, cold snow melts with the suns hot beams.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Henry my lord is cold in great affairs,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Too full of foolish pity, and Gloucesters show

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Beguiles him as the mournful crocodile

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: With sorrow snares relenting passengers,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Or as the snake rolld in a flowering bank,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: With shining chequerd slough, doth sting a child

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That for the beauty thinks it excellent.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Believe me, lords, were none more wise than I--

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And yet herein I judge mine own wit good--

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: This Gloucester should be quickly rid the world,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To rid us of the fear we have of him.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: That he should die is worthy policy;

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: But yet we want a colour for his death:

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Tis meet he be condemnd by course of law.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But, in my mind, that were no policy:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The king will labour still to save his life,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The commons haply rise, to save his life;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And yet we have but trivial argument,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: More than mistrust, that shows him worthy death.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: So that, by this, you would not have him die.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Ah, York, no man alive so fain as I!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Tis York that hath more reason for his death.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: But, my lord cardinal, and you, my Lord of Suffolk,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Say as you think, and speak it from your souls,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Weret not all one, an empty eagle were set

speaker: YORK
text_entry: To guard the chicken from a hungry kite,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: As place Duke Humphrey for the kings protector?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: So the poor chicken should be sure of death.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Madam, tis true; and weret not madness, then,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To make the fox surveyor of the fold?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Who being accused a crafty murderer,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: His guilt should be but idly posted over,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Because his purpose is not executed.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: No; let him die, in that he is a fox,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: By nature proved an enemy to the flock,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Before his chaps be staind with crimson blood,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As Humphrey, proved by reasons, to my liege.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And do not stand on quillets how to slay him:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Be it by gins, by snares, by subtlety,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Sleeping or waking, tis no matter how,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So he be dead; for that is good deceit

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Which mates him first that first intends deceit.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Thrice-noble Suffolk, tis resolutely spoke.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Not resolute, except so much were done;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: For things are often spoke and seldom meant:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But that my heart accordeth with my tongue,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Seeing the deed is meritorious,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And to preserve my sovereign from his foe,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Say but the word, and I will be his priest.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: But I would have him dead, my Lord of Suffolk,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Ere you can take due orders for a priest:

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Say you consent and censure well the deed,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: And Ill provide his executioner,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: I tender so the safety of my liege.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Here is my hand, the deed is worthy doing.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And so say I.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And I    and now we three have spoke it,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: It skills not greatly who impugns our doom.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Enter a Post

speaker: Post
text_entry: Great lords, from Ireland am I come amain,

speaker: Post
text_entry: To signify that rebels there are up

speaker: Post
text_entry: And put the Englishmen unto the sword:

speaker: Post
text_entry: Send succors, lords, and stop the rage betime,

speaker: Post
text_entry: Before the wound do grow uncurable;

speaker: Post
text_entry: For, being green, there is great hope of help.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: A breach that craves a quick expedient stop!

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: What counsel give you in this weighty cause?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: That Somerset be sent as regent thither:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Tis meet that lucky ruler be employd;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Witness the fortune he hath had in France.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: If York, with all his far-fet policy,

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Had been the regent there instead of me,

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: He never would have stayd in France so long.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: No, not to lose it all, as thou hast done:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I rather would have lost my life betimes

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Than bring a burthen of dishonour home

speaker: YORK
text_entry: By staying there so long till all were lost.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Show me one scar characterd on thy skin:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Mens flesh preserved so whole do seldom win.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Nay, then, this spark will prove a raging fire,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: If wind and fuel be brought to feed it with:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: No more, good York; sweet Somerset, be still:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Thy fortune, York, hadst thou been regent there,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Might happily have proved far worse than his.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: What, worse than nought? nay, then, a shame take all!

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: And, in the number, thee that wishest shame!

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: My Lord of York, try what your fortune is.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: The uncivil kerns of Ireland are in arms

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: And temper clay with blood of Englishmen:

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: To Ireland will you lead a band of men,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Collected choicely, from each county some,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: And try your hap against the Irishmen?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I will, my lord, so please his majesty.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Why, our authority is his consent,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And what we do establish he confirms:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Then, noble York, take thou this task in hand.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I am content: provide me soldiers, lords,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Whiles I take order for mine own affairs.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: A charge, Lord York, that I will see performd.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But now return we to the false Duke Humphrey.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: No more of him; for I will deal with him

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: That henceforth he shall trouble us no more.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: And so break off; the day is almost spent:

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Lord Suffolk, you and I must talk of that event.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: My Lord of Suffolk, within fourteen days

speaker: YORK
text_entry: At Bristol I expect my soldiers;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: For there Ill ship them all for Ireland.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Ill see it truly done, my Lord of York.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Exeunt all but YORK

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Now, York, or never, steel thy fearful thoughts,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And change misdoubt to resolution:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Be that thou hopest to be, or what thou art

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Resign to death; it is not worth the enjoying:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Let pale-faced fear keep with the mean-born man,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And find no harbour in a royal heart.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Faster than spring-time showers comes thought

speaker: YORK
text_entry: on thought,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And not a thought but thinks on dignity.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: My brain more busy than the labouring spider

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Weaves tedious snares to trap mine enemies.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Well, nobles, well, tis politicly done,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: To send me packing with an host of men:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I fear me you but warm the starved snake,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Who, cherishd in your breasts, will sting

speaker: YORK
text_entry: your hearts.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Twas men I lackd and you will give them me:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I take it kindly; and yet be well assured

speaker: YORK
text_entry: You put sharp weapons in a madmans hands.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Whiles I in Ireland nourish a mighty band,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I will stir up in England some black storm

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Shall blow ten thousand souls to heaven or hell;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And this fell tempest shall not cease to rage

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Until the golden circuit on my head,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Like to the glorious suns transparent beams,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Do calm the fury of this mad-bred flaw.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And, for a minister of my intent,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I have seduced a headstrong Kentishman,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: John Cade of Ashford,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: To make commotion, as full well he can,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Under the title of John Mortimer.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: In Ireland have I seen this stubborn Cade

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Oppose himself against a troop of kerns,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And fought so long, till that his thighs with darts

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Were almost like a sharp-quilld porpentine;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And, in the end being rescued, I have seen

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Him caper upright like a wild Morisco,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Shaking the bloody darts as he his bells.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Full often, like a shag-haird crafty kern,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Hath he conversed with the enemy,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And undiscoverd come to me again

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And given me notice of their villanies.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: This devil here shall be my substitute;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: For that John Mortimer, which now is dead,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: In face, in gait, in speech, he doth resemble:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: By this I shall perceive the commons mind,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: How they affect the house and claim of York.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Say he be taken, rackd and tortured,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I know no pain they can inflict upon him

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Will make him say I moved him to those arms.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Say that he thrive, as tis great like he will,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Why, then from Ireland come I with my strength

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And reap the harvest which that rascal sowd;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: For Humphrey being dead, as he shall be,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And Henry put apart, the next for me.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Exit

speaker: YORK
text_entry: SCENE II. Bury St. Edmunds. A room of state.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Enter certain Murderers, hastily

text_entry: Run to my Lord of Suffolk; let him know

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: We have dispatchd the duke, as he commanded.

speaker: Second Murderer
text_entry: O that it were to do! What have we done?

speaker: Second Murderer
text_entry: Didst ever hear a man so penitent?

speaker: Second Murderer
text_entry: Enter SUFFOLK

text_entry: Here comes my lord.

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: Ay, my good lord, hes dead.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Why, thats well said. Go, get you to my house;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I will reward you for this venturous deed.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The king and all the peers are here at hand.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Have you laid fair the bed? Is all things well,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: According as I gave directions?

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: Tis, my good lord.

speaker: SUFFOLK

text_entry: Say we intend to try his grace to-day.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: If he be guilty, as tis published.

text_entry: Ill call him presently, my noble lord.

text_entry: Lords, take your places; and, I pray you all,

text_entry: Proceed no straiter gainst our uncle Gloucester

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Than from true evidence of good esteem

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: He be approved in practise culpable.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: God forbid any malice should prevail,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That faultless may condemn a nobleman!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Pray God he may acquit him of suspicion!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I thank thee, Meg; these words content me much.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Re-enter SUFFOLK

text_entry: How now! why lookst thou pale? why tremblest thou?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Where is our uncle? whats the matter, Suffolk?

speaker: SUFFOLK

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Marry, God forfend!

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Gods secret judgment: I did dream to-night

text_entry: The duke was dumb and could not speak a word.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: KING HENRY VI swoons

text_entry: How fares my lord? Help, lords! the king is dead.

text_entry: Rear up his body; wring him by the nose.

text_entry: Run, go, help, help! O Henry, ope thine eyes!

text_entry: He doth revive again: madam, be patient.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: O heavenly God!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: How fares my gracious lord?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Comfort, my sovereign! gracious Henry, comfort!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: What, doth my Lord of Suffolk comfort me?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Came he right now to sing a ravens note,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Whose dismal tune bereft my vital powers;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And thinks he that the chirping of a wren,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: By crying comfort from a hollow breast,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Can chase away the first-conceived sound?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Hide not thy poison with such sugard words;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Lay not thy hands on me; forbear, I say;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Their touch affrights me as a serpents sting.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Thou baleful messenger, out of my sight!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Upon thy eye-balls murderous tyranny

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Sits in grim majesty, to fright the world.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Look not upon me, for thine eyes are wounding:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Yet do not go away: come, basilisk,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And kill the innocent gazer with thy sight;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For in the shade of death I shall find joy;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: In life but double death, now Gloucesters dead.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Why do you rate my Lord of Suffolk thus?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Although the duke was enemy to him,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Yet he most Christian-like laments his death:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And for myself, foe as he was to me,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Might liquid tears or heart-offending groans

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Or blood-consuming sighs recall his life,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I would be blind with weeping, sick with groans,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Look pale as primrose with blood-drinking sighs,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And all to have the noble duke alive.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What know I how the world may deem of me?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For it is known we were but hollow friends:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: It may be judged I made the duke away;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: So shall my name with slanders tongue be wounded,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And princes courts be filld with my reproach.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: This get I by his death: ay me, unhappy!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To be a queen, and crownd with infamy!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Ah, woe is me for Gloucester, wretched man!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Be woe for me, more wretched than he is.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What, dost thou turn away and hide thy face?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I am no loathsome leper; look on me.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What! art thou, like the adder, waxen deaf?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Be poisonous too and kill thy forlorn queen.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Is all thy comfort shut in Gloucesters tomb?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Why, then, dame Margaret was neer thy joy.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Erect his statue and worship it,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And make my image but an alehouse sign.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Was I for this nigh wreckd upon the sea

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And twice by awkward wind from Englands bank

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Drove back again unto my native clime?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What boded this, but well forewarning wind

text_entry: Did seem to say Seek not a scorpions nest,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Nor set no footing on this unkind shore?

text_entry: What did I then, but cursed the gentle gusts

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And he that loosed them forth their brazen caves:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And bid them blow towards Englands blessed shore,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Or turn our stern upon a dreadful rock

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Yet AEolus would not be a murderer,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: But left that hateful office unto thee:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The pretty-vaulting sea refused to drown me,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Knowing that thou wouldst have me drownd on shore,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: With tears as salt as sea, through thy unkindness:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The splitting rocks cowerd in the sinking sands

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And would not dash me with their ragged sides,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Because thy flinty heart, more hard than they,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Might in thy palace perish Margaret.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: As far as I could ken thy chalky cliffs,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: When from thy shore the tempest beat us back,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I stood upon the hatches in the storm,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And when the dusky sky began to rob

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: My earnest-gaping sight of thy lands view,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I took a costly jewel from my neck,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: A heart it was, bound in with diamonds,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And threw it towards thy land: the sea received it,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And so I wishd thy body might my heart:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And even with this I lost fair Englands view

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And bid mine eyes be packing with my heart

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And calld them blind and dusky spectacles,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For losing ken of Albions wished coast.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: How often have I tempted Suffolks tongue,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The agent of thy foul inconstancy,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To sit and witch me, as Ascanius did

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: When he to madding Dido would unfold

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: His fathers acts commenced in burning Troy!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Am I not witchd like her? or thou not false like him?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Ay me, I can no more! die, Margaret!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For Henry weeps that thou dost live so long.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Noise within. Enter WARWICK, SALISBURY, and many Commons

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: It is reported, mighty sovereign,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: That good Duke Humphrey traitorously is murderd

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: By Suffolk and the Cardinal Beauforts means.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: The commons, like an angry hive of bees

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: That want their leader, scatter up and down

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And care not who they sting in his revenge.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Myself have calmd their spleenful mutiny,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Until they hear the order of his death.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That he is dead, good Warwick, tis too true;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: But how he died God knows, not Henry:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Enter his chamber, view his breathless corpse,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And comment then upon his sudden death.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: That shall I do, my liege. Stay, Salisbury,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: With the rude multitude till I return.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: O Thou that judgest all things, stay my thoughts,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My thoughts, that labour to persuade my soul

speaker: KING HENRY VI
